column4: when i first login into ubuntu us there a windows "f8" equivalent or a way to go into command prompt before going into X ?
it iscalled grub
i can't see grub as my laptop screen is broken. I'm trying to get into terminal on my external screen to change my X settings to boot into external montior
ah, one sec, you have ssh server on lappy?
laptop
Does your laptop run ssh server?
no it just has the client
i found it i think it was ctrl shift F1
Did you try to hook up monitor and run LiveCD?
so you have terminal, cool.
well i'm on the external montir and i fonially got it to go into terminal on the external. now it's time to figure out how to edit the x.org file and its location
this? http://wiki.debian.org/XStrikeForce/HowToRandR12
xrandr is treturning can't open display
can you try: xini -- :1 vt8 ?
it starts ubuntu in the wrong montior
so you do not get term?
i'm on terminal but when i do xinit -- .... it shuyts down the external screen and goes to laptop one
ok, one sec
stop gdm and: sudo X -configure
You should get this file: /etc/X11/xorg.conf
and this should be all: http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/debian-linux/100317-disabling-laptop-lcd.html
my x.org only contains one monitor/screen
